utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I should could go for something sweet.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you want to grab food?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it’s not food that I’m craving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Is it –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, it’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I happen to be an expert on nothing. And this? This is not nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Um, do you know how you talk in your sleep sometimes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, last night you said a name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. And not your name, I assume.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t read anything into one random utterance –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fourteen utterances, and the name was Jordan. You said it over and over again. Who’s Jordan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it a woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! It’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I know nothing. Nothing is a dear friend of mine and this is not nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, it is. Besides, most of what I say is meaningless. Why would it be any different when I’m asleep?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not done here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. Who is Jordan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve got nothing to hide, there’s just nothing to tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why are you being so defensive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I’ll just wait until you’re asleep and then I’ll ask you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. You just said you have nothing to hide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but interrogating me in my sleep? Would you stoop that low?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who says I haven’t already?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Talk about death by chocolate.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t blame it on the chocolate, Castle. A bullet’s what did him in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that red stuff’s not raspberry sauce?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: ‘fraid not. Exit wound.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was shot in the back and then fell in the mixer?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like. But before that he may have struggled with his attacker. Beige fibers. They were caught on his watch band. CSU will run an analysis.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER EPSPOSITO
utterance.content: Vic’s name is Jimmy Whelan. He’s the owner of the shop. He has no record and nothing in his bio that points to who did this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can rule out dissatisfied customer. These things are insanely good.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ew. You’re eating a dead man’s cupcake?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s … free samples. Want one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Between 11:30 and 12.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on what? All of a sudden you’re an M.E?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought you liked it when I played doctor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I, uh … based the time of death on what the vic’s assistant told me. Right over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay Todd, why don’t you just run us through what happened.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Jimmy sent me on a delivery at 11:30. A dozen red velvets to a beauty shop down the way. And when I came back … he’s a super nice guy, Jimmy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was there anyone in his life that didn’t feel that way?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: I’m not sure. Truth is, it’s only my second week here. But he was acting real strange right before I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Strange how?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: This car cruised by the shop, kinda slow. He got all nervous. That’s when he sent me on my run, like he wanted to get rid of me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of car was it?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: It was a black ’68 Charger LT. I know my muscle cars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see who was driving?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: No. But whoever it was parked around the corner as I was leaving. When I got back the car was gone. There was Jimmy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well we’ll need a detailed description of that car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. It looks like Jimmy kept a lot of dough around here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is a bakery.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good one. This briefcase was stashed in his office. That’s $50 thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. At $4 dollars a pop, he’d have to sell 12,500 cupcakes. That seems unlikely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Todd, what do you know about that money?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Nothing. I swear. But he was real paranoid about that case. Twice a week he’d take it out of the safe and take it with him down to Staten Island.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Just said he had business there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well obviously Jimmy was in to more than just baking cupcakes so let’s look at all owners of ’68 Chargers in the Metro area.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, where’s Ryan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ohh right.

utterance.speaker: JENNY RYAN
utterance.content: The appointment at Dr. Rosenberg’s office is in 20 minutes. It’s going to take us at least 15 to get there, so we should probably go, right? Which means you should probably …

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Hey. What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: What if it’s my fault? What if … it turns out there’s something wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: It’s nobody’s fault, Kev. We just need to know what’s going on. Want some help?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh …. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So master baker Jimmy Whelan, long time purveyor of caloric, yet delicious, baked goods, sponsor of a local kids softball team, charter member of the small business round table, but what was he doing with $50 grand in cash and why the secret trips to Staten Island?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like you’re not the only one keeping secrets, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to ignore that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s peculiar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s peculiar about wanting to ignore –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. I mean these purchase orders. They show that Jimmy spent over $70,000 dollars on kitchen equipment. Like a 20 foot wide walk-in freezer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t remember seeing that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s because there wasn’t one. It wouldn’t even fit in his kitchen.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So I ran ’68 Chargers. There’s only a handful of them on the road. But get this, one of them is registered to a Robert S Shannon, aka Bobby S He’s a shot caller for the Irish mob over in Staten Island. He’s a ruthless son of a b*tch, too. Drug trafficking, assault. He’s suspected in over half a dozen murders over in Staten Island.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Secret trips to Staten Island, all that cash. What if the cupcake shop is actually a mob front? Jimmy Whelan the baker is really Jimmy Whelan the money launderer. Bobby S could have had a falling out with him, could’ve whacked him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe, but we’re going to need more than just his car at the crime scene to connect him to that murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well I may have somebody who can help us out with that. I pulled Jimmy’s phone records and the last three days he received numerous calls from a woman named uh … … um … Siban? Sio – Sib –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Siobhan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Siobhan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, the Irish are notorious for spelling names in wild and unpronounceable ways.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t even see how you get that from –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anyway, Siobhan O’Doul, she runs a bar over in Staten Island. And according to Organized Crime, it’s a place where Bobby S does a lot of his business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does Siobhan happen to own that bar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She does, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming in, Ms. O’Doul.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, especially considering that a felony charge like obstruction would cost you your liquor license.

utterance.speaker: SIOBBHAN
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need some answers about Jimmy Whelan.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Never heard of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s funny, considering you made seven phone calls to him over the last three days.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Oh, Jimmy the baker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I – I’m thinking of ordering some cupcakes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you missed your chance. He was killed.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Earlier today. Do you know anything about it?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: No. Why would I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we think someone that frequents your bar was involved. What can you tell me about Bobby S?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: I’m not saying another word. Gimme my phone call. I want my phone call now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. What’s up, man?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry I’m late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did the thing go … with the uh, you know. Do the thing with the thing and give the thing to the doctor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, uh … it went … fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So are your swimmers swimming?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know yet. Hey, we caught a case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. As a matter of fact, let me bring you up to speed.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Hi guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up Jenny?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Kevin, you forgot your lunch.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, baby.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: What would you do without me, huh?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Fenton?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Siobhan?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Fenton!

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Hey! What the hell are you doing? That’s my husband!

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: You’re married?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lady, you can’t slap a cop!

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: You’re a cop?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: You liar! You son of a b*tch! How could you? Get off of me! Let go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you know about this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not a thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible our Ryan is involved in something scandalous and tawdry?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan? No way. He doesn’t have it in him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you see the way Siobhan gave him that flying lip lock? Ooh, look. Jenny’s pissed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, it’s not surprising when you find out someone you’re in a relationship with is keeping a secret.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be cool. Here he comes. Act normal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Act normal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I – this is normal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn. Bobby S. Are we thinking that this guy is the one that took out Jimmy Whelan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you know Bobby S?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We were … friends back in the day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were friends with the low-life? How’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We used to run in the same crew. I was undercover for fourteen months before I joined homicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were undercover on Staten Island?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With the Irish mob?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. So, what do we got on Bobby S?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, hold up, hold up, hold up. Just go back for a second, please. You were undercover. That’s when you and Siobhan used to –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s – complicated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love complicated.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’s Siobhan connected to all this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She knows the vic. And she knows Bobby S, obviously. But she’s not talking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, maybe she’ll talk to me.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: So I guess it’s not Fenton O’Connell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s Kevin. Kevin Ryan.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Well at least you’re Irish. You didn’t lie about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I didn’t lie about a lot of things.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: They said you went into hiding. Seven years. Without a word.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: You do not know!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Believe me, I didn’t want to go.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Spare me. You didn’t even have the guts to tell me to my face. Just a note on the dresser.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Siobhan, I know you’re angry. If you’re in trouble, if you know something about Bobby S killing this guy, tell me. Let me help.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: You can go straight to hell. Cop!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Deep cover? Can’t believe he didn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, he didn’t even tell Jenny.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’m the best friend. She’s just the wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thus proving why there is no Mrs. Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. It’s hard to find a woman for this much man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, how’d it go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It didn’t. So, what do we think Bobby’s motive was for killing this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know. But it seems that the two of them had a falling out of some sort.

utterance.speaker: AGENT SAM WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah, you could put it that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you are?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Special Agent Sam Walker, FBI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Beckett, this is Detective Ryan and Esposito.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Ryan? Kevin Ryan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’ve heard of him?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. This man got inside the Irish mob with a wire when no one else could. He helped put away half the crew in Staten Island.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Too bad the weeds grew back, huh?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: They always do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s the FBI’s interest in our murder investigation?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Your victim, Jimmy Whelan. He was my informant.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Jimmy was just running his shop, trying to get by. But then when the economy turned he borrowed some hard money and after that Bobby S owned him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Jimmy was feeding you intel on Bobby’s operations.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Oh, more than that. He was going to help us get the crew’s bible.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The bible?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m guessing we’re not talking about the Holy Book.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, it’s just something the crew called it. It’s a list of transactions and contacts going back years. You get that bible you’ll get the whole crew.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So now that Jimmy’s gone you’re back to square one.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Pretty much. Though we still have Siobhan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: She’s my informant, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? Siobhan wouldn’t snitch.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Maybe not the old Siobhan. But the truth is, once you left she fell on hard times. They crew drinks at her bad. They talk to her, they trust her. Bobby S even keeps an office in the basement, so when she wanted out, we made an offer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: For what? Witness Protection?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah. If she helps us bring down the crew. Helping us get the bible, that was going to be her ticket. Well, until Bobby S figured out that Bobby was a rat and had him killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that’s why she called Jimmy? To warn him?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah. Jimmy thought he could talk his way out of it. Of course, he couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what happens to Siobhan now?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: She goes back in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She can’t. Not now. It’s too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: She knows the risks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Walker, if we linked her to Jimmy, then Bobby S can too.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Look, Siobhan is free to walk away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And go where? You don’t just walk away from Bobby S. Everybody knows that. He’s going to hunt her down. You have to put her in Witness Protection.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah, for the bible, sure. But Witness Protection isn’t some entitlement program. Siobhan has to earn it. Excuse me. I have to meet with her now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Feds are hanging her out to dry. When Bobby finds out he’ll kill her for sure.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Look Siobhan, the main thing is not to panic. You don’t want to do anything that might arouse suspicion. Just keep your head down for a while, you’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. You’ll be dead.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Look at you, telling the truth. Cop is right. I’m screwed six ways to Sunday here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where does Bobby S keep the bible?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: In his bedroom safe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How was Jimmy gonna get it?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Every Thursday Jimmy has the guys over to bet on pool. Jimmy was supposed to do it then.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about the combination?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Bobby changes it every Friday. But I know the system he uses.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And Jimmy could get the bible because he was one of the crew, and he had access to Bobby S’s house.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: And now we’ve got no one inside.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll go in. I’ll get the bible.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Really? You? How?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know how close I was to Bobby S back then. My Fenton O’Connell cover is still good.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Detective, that was seven years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As far as the crew knows, I bolted when the Feds swooped in. You guys even filed indictments against Fenton O’Connell, right?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How long has law enforcement been after that bible? Fifteen? Twenty years? Huh? These guys are drug dealing parasites. When are you going to get another shot to wipe them all out? Look, you want the bible. We want Bobby S for murder. Siobhan wants to keep breathing. Everybody wins. I can do this.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Let me run this by my ASAC.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: What are you doing? Are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was Fenton. I can be him again.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Don’t get yourself killed on my account.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, yeah, you hate me. I get that and I deserve it. But do you want to be put in Witness Relocation or not? Yes or no?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Detective? Were you serious about that offer?

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKTER
utterance.content: You’ve been out of it a long time, Detective. There’s a new hierarchy. And you’re going to have to win them over, fast.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: Seven years since you’ve been Fenton. It’s not enough to act like him. You must become him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I am Fenton O’Connell.

utterance.speaker: AGENT WALKER
utterance.content: If you’re not convincing, you’re dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I am Fenton O’Connell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I am Fenton O’Connell.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t like this, bro. You don’t have a wire. No locator.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If I did, Bobby S would find it. This is the way it’s gotta be, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s the name of Agent Walker’s informants who’ll vouch for you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Mason brothers. Matt and Tony.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where did you do your last stretch?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Elmira, for man 1. Can even tell you my cell number. I know what I’m doing, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about Siobhan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our plan is solid. I got this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: See you on the other side, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? This is the welcome I get? Huh? Any of you Irish bastards miss me, huh?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Fenton? Fenton O’Connell?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Siobhan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And nice to see you too, Maggie.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: And what’d you expect? A parade? After what you did to Siobhan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, one shot’s all you get.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Hey, talk your hands off the lady.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Long as she keeps her hands off of me.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Seven years, Fenton. Where the hell’ve you been?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t get pissed. I get it. We’ll work all this out … maybe a little less publically. First I need to talk to Bobby S.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Oh, that’s why you came back? For Bobby?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just let me handle my business and then I’ll have nothing but time for you.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Oh, you are such a charmer. But if it’s Bobby S you’re after, you’re going to have to go through his number two.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah? Who might that be?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: My husband. Liam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m telling you, man. He’s not the Ryan I know. And I’m not just talking about the haircut and the clothes. It’s like he’s a different dude.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what he’s supposed to be. He’s in character. He’s Fenton. That’s good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if he’s not good enough? After seven years he’s gotta be rusty. And these Staten Island boys are no joke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, the best way to help Ryan is by building a case against Bobby S.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That might be trickier than we thought. Bobby S’s ’68 Charger has an electronic EZ-Pass. And records show the Charger drove to Yonkers near the George Washington Bridge around 10AM. Didn’t make the return trip ‘til after 2PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jimmy was killed between 11:30 and 12. That puts Bobby in the clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is that possible? The car that Todd saw outside the bakery had to have been Bobby S’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he somehow disabled his EZ-Pass, making it appear as though all he did was go to and from Yonkers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, yeah, but how do we prove that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We figure out where he went when he was in Yonkers and then we find evidence that he left during our time of death window. He’s trying to build an alibi and we’re going to tear it down.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Give me your phone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Bobby S has an abiding distrust of electronic devices. Give me your phone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. What will the missus think?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Bobby!

utterance.speaker: BOBBY S
utterance.content: Do I know you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The hell? It’s me, Fenton.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I recall knowing a Fenton O’Connell years ago. He was like a brother to me. A real stand-up guy. ‘til he cut and ran.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, Bobby. I got ratted out. You know that. Me hanging around would’ve just brought more heat down on everyone.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: So you made yourself scarce. In fact, no one’s heard from you in … seven years. Where you been?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Out west. Been making some moves here and there ‘til the statute of limitations ran out. To tell you the truth Bobby, I didn’t want to come home until I had something to bring to the table.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Well, friend. Here’s the table.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I heard the Feds took down Ben Gideon, so you might be in need of some product. I’ve been working with the Mason brothers out of Chicago.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: I’ve heard of them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is table source, quality stuff. I can get you whatever you need. This is me stepping up, Bobby.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: So, what? You’re the wild rover from the song? Returning with gold in great store, is that it? Or are you a rat?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know me better than that. Well, I said my peace. And I’m not going to beg, Bobby. It’s up to you, okay?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah, it is. So, should I welcome home the prodigal son? Or should I have Liam put a bullet in the back of your head?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Oh, just say the word, Bobby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think I’m some kind of rat? That I’m a man without honor? Then you pull the trigger. You doubt me, Bobby? You do it yourself.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Fenton’s back. Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Still here. What can I get you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pint of the black stuff.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Glasses in the air. Luke 15:32.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: What the hell kind of a toast is that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where did you find this heathen, Bobby? Didn’t you ever go to Sunday school? ‘We should celebrate and rejoice, because – ‘

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: ‘- because your brother here was dead and has come to life.’ Welcome home. To Fenton!

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: What do you think of him?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter what I think. It’s up to Bobby S.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah, but do you buy his story? About where he’s been for the last seven years?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I’m going to check it out.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: And if he’s lying about something?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Then I’ll kill the bastard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I think I figured out where Bobby S went in Yonkers. The raceway. He pulled out $500 dollars in cash from the ATM there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Betting on the ponies. Any security cameras in the parking lot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo’s checking right now, but if we can prove that he left just before our time of death window then that should help us nail him for the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. Thank you. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, do we know how Ryan’s doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. And I hate not knowing things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. Uh, Jordan is not a woman, all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then who is it? Or rather, what is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why does it matter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because, Castle, it matters to you. Why won’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s identified the fibers on Jimmy Whelan. … they’re … wool from an Australian sheep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Perhaps Bobby S had an accomplice. A cold-blooded, murderous sheep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not that. This. Look. Look at the jacket he’s wearing. It’s leather shearling. With wool.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That ties him to the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not so fast. There were no cameras in the VIP parking area of the racetrack, but it turns out Bobby S had a lucky day. His 40 to 1 longshot won. Netted him $14 grand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And wearing the same coat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Problem is, he’s filling out his W2-G tax forms at the exact same time Jimmy got whacked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then Bobby S can’t be our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was being set up. Someone borrowed Bobby S’s car and planted those fibers all in an effort to make him look like the killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If someone is trying to set Bobby S up, Ryan needs to know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo. It’s risky meeting like this. It better be important.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bobby S didn’t kill Jimmy. The real killer took his car and set him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or Bobby ordered the hit. And loaned his car to the killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, bro. Forensic evidence was purposely left behind. It’s a frame. Probably someone from his own crew.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll keep my eyes open.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What good is that going to do you? Huh? What good is that going to do you when something goes down? I’m not there to back you up. What you need to do is walk away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll walk away when I’m done.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s wrong with you? You got a lot to lose. You’ve got Jenny, you’re trying to start a family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t need you to tell me what’s at stake here. Look man, I got invited to Bobby S’s pool game tonight. This is it. This is my shot at getting that bible.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not worth it, man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll call you when I get it.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: How can Bobby S not be the killer? I heard him say Jimmy was a rat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Someone else must have heard that, too.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Someone in the crew?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Has to be, right?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: This is bad. You can’t go to the pool game tonight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have to go. I won’t get another chance. You won’t get another chance. What’s the combination to Bobby S’s safe?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 304217. How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Bobby has me ring up a total on the cash register on Friday nights. He bases the combination on that total.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re going to get through this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. You still have this little guy? Wait, um … what was his name again?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: How could you forget? Mr. Whiskers. You spent over $50 bucks trying to win him for me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That ring toss was a b*tch.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Well it was worth every penny. He’s seen me through some pretty tough times. Was any of it real?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What I felt was. I gotta go. Big night tonight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So the canvass at Yonkers Raceway came up with something. A parking attendant say Bobby S’s black Charger. It returned 30 minutes after the murder. He only saw it from a distance, but he said the driver was wearing a baseball cap and walked to the subway stop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s touch base with the MTA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Already did. I cross referenced all Metro cards swiped at that time. One was bought with a credit card and that credit card belonged to Liam Finch. That’s Bobby S’s number two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a coup. Liam is framing Bobby to get him out of the way. He wants to take over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Ryan walked right in the middle of it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Worse. He didn’t walk into the middle, he walked in as Bobby S’s friend. That makes him Liam’s enemy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we have to warn him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we call him we could blow his cover.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If we don’t he could end up dead.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Get the hell out of here. Since when did you become such a pool hustler?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just call me Fast Eddie.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: C’mere. I went over your numbers and I can live with them. So how soon can you get some of that Chicago crank up here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can get you five pounds by this weekend. Come next week I can get you however much you want.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Love it. Take your shot. Lucky bastard.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It’s Keane. Says it’s urgent.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Yeah Keane.

utterance.speaker: KEANE
utterance.content: Liam, you were right. We’ve got a rat in the house.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. I’ve gotta hit the head.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: How soon can you bring my car out front?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Hey, sport. Been looking for you. Bobby S needs us to take a ride.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. Let me get my phone.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: You’re not going to be needing that. Car’s out back. You’re driving.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Be right back.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Time to go … Fenton.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s still not answering.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Bobby S doesn’t allow cell phones in his presence. Maybe he and Ryan are still just playing pool.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What did Agent Walker say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Feds don’t know any more than we do about where Ryan is. Something’s not right.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Guys … … is Kevin in trouble?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, no. We’re just talking some procedure stuff.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Don’t lie to me, Javi. What’s going on? Where’s my husband?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jenny, maybe we should go get a coffee.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: So you don’t know where he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … no. But we are going to find him. And um, we don’t believe he’s in any immediate danger.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Why would he do a thing like this? Maybe he thinks he has something to prove. You know, because of all our … pregnancy stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I think there are probably a number of reasons, but the main one is that he just wants to do the right thing. I mean, that’s who he is. That’s why he became a cop, that’s why you fell in love with him.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: I just want him to come home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Beckett. I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We going to the docks?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only two things to do at the docks: kill someone or go fishing. Kind of late to be fishing, ain’t it?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Yep. All the fishes are asleep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What now, huh?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: I had my suspicions about you since the moment you walked into Siobhan’s bar. But no, everybody said, ‘Fenton’s stand-up’. Everybody vouched for you, even Bobby S.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you still had your doubts, huh?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: That’s right. So I had Keane follow you around today. You know, I knew we had a rat amongst us. But what I didn’t figure was how that rat could hide in plain sight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Siobhan?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: So am I, brother.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Keane followed you over to Siobhan’s place.

utterance.speaker: KEANE
utterance.content: Yeah, I spoke with one of her neighbors. Turns out she was picked up by the cops two days ago.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: Being any inquisitive lad, Keane broke into her place. Tell him what you found, Keane.

utterance.speaker: KEANE
utterance.content: I went through her cell phone, Fenton. Man, she’s been talking with the FBI.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: After all this time, nothing but a snitch. A Judas with an angel’s face. Now Fenton, you know me. I’m nothing it not fair. So I’m going to give you a fair chance to prove you knew nothing about this.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Blow her brains out.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Fenton, we’re leaving with one or two bodies tonight. It’s up to you.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: It’s okay. It’s not your fault. Just do it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, I just can’t do it, Bobby. I can’t shoot her. However I have no problem shooting you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Empty. You son of a b*tch.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Had to be sure, friend. And damn, so disappointed in you, Fenton.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not as disappointed as you’re about to be. My name’s not Fenton. It’s Kevin Ryan. And I’m a cop.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: What? Cop?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And I’m placing the three of you under arrest.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: That’ll be a hell of a trick, considering Liam’s about to shoot you and your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a second, Liam, before you do that, let me ask you a question. Where’s your cell phone, huh?

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Remember when we tussled back in the hall? Yeah, I picked your pocket. And then when you weren’t looking I dialed my partner and left the line open.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He heard exactly where we were going.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Liam.

utterance.speaker: LIAM
utterance.content: He’s full of crap, Bobby. He’s bluffing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, am I? Why don’t we meet my partner, huh? Yo Javi, where you at?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right here, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa … he is former special forces. You do not want to draw on him. Wanna meet the rest of my crew? Hey Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You called, Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t let the looks fool you, boys. You don’t’ want to mess with her either. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? I didn’t – I didn’t bring my vest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drop your weapons. Now.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I got the best lawyer in New York. I’m gonna walk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not when I hand the Feds this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh oh. Snazzy three piece suit can only mean one thing. Ryan is back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So where are we with Liam?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett’s got him in the box trying to get him to confess to Jimmy Whelan’s murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Agent Walker called. He said the bible you gave him is gold. Bobby S and his whole crew are going down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Javi, the other day, at the diner –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t sweat it. That wasn’t you talking, man. That was Fenton.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys aren’t going to believe this, but Liam is not our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you talking about? It was his Metro card, paid for by his own credit card. And then he swiped it after he dropped off Bobby S’s car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, but his alibi is solid. He was on Staten Island at that time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, if he has a solid alibi the question remains is, who had access to his Metro card?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maggie. You know, I pegged you for a lot of things. Never a killer.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I pegged you for a lot of things, but never a narc.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, see, I’m a homicide detective. Which is why I know that you killed Jimmy the baker.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Jimmy the who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, are we actually going to play this game? It’s late, I’m tired. Officers went through your house and they found your gun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Same caliber that killed Jimmy. It’s only a matter of time before we get a ballistics match.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Liam had no idea what his wife was doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it was all Maggie. She knew that Liam was too loyal and she figured if she could get Bobby S in prison her husband could ascend to the throne.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So really Lady Maggie was Lady Macbeth. Only she was Irish, not Scottish.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … listen, Kate. About Jordan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? If you don’t want to talk about it –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I wanna. But what happens if you don’t like what you see?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happens if you don’t let me look?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jordan Motor Company. They made cars from 1916 to 1931.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Jordan? That’s the big secret? A defunct car company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sort of. It goes back to my boarding school days. My first semester, I was in danger of flunking out. I needed an A on my term paper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you wrote the paper on that car company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Someone else did. And I paid him $250 dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … Castle, that happened when you were a kid. I don’t understand why that would change how I see you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it changed how I saw myself. The teacher read the paper to the entire class as an example of great writing and I was applauded. It was the first time I was celebrated for anything and … it was a fraud. I – I was a fraud. That’s when I learned how to write. I wrote and wrote, trying to be as great as everyone thought I was, trying to earn that applause. I’m still trying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right, Castle. It does change how I see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It makes me like you just a little bit more.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t forget Mr. Whiskers.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Oh, so now you remember his name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could you give us a second? Please?

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: I was hoping you’d come.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I wanted to say goodbye this time.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Goodbye makes me feel like I’ll never see you again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You won’t. Tomorrow you’ll be in a new city. Have a new name. You’ll get to start over again.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: Why’d you do this? Risk your life for me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know why.

utterance.speaker: SIOBHAN
utterance.content: This Kevin Ryan guy? I wish I would have met him sooner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Jenny. I know it wasn’t fair to you.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Just tell me the truth. Is this part of your life, this undercover part, over?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it is now.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Good. Because I need to know that you’re going to be here. I – I need to know that I can depend on you. Especially after the test results we got back from the fertility doctor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh no. Bad news?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Yeah. We took all those damn tests for nothing. I’m already pregnant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re pregnant?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re pregnant!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah! Let’s – let’s pop some champagne.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. No.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We – we – we can’t pop any champagne. Do you know why? Because – you’re pregnant.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: - I’m pregnant.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
